title: Ultra Creamy Mashed Potatoes from Swanson Recipe
description: Try mashed potatoes cooked with chicken broth instead of water, for a super savory side dish. Blended with cream and butter, they're perfectly smooth!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Ultra Creamy Mashed Potatoes from Swanson 4.4 (94) 77 Reviews 52 Photos Want to know a secret? Mashed potatoes cooked with chicken broth are extra flavorful! This savory side is perfectly smooth and creamy, with just the right amount of butter and cream for everyone to enjoy. These potatoes are delicious when served with your favorite Campbell's gravy. Submitted by Campbell's Kitchen Updated on May 12, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 52 52 52 52 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 6 Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces 2 cups Swanson chicken broth ½ cup light cream 2 tablespoons butter salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Combine potatoes and chicken broth in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium, cover, and cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes well in a colander, reserving the broth. Transfer potatoes back to the pan. Add reserved broth, cream, and butter. Mash until smooth and season with salt and pepper. Recipe Tips You can also use Swanson certified organic chicken broth or Swanson Natural Goodness chicken broth.For ultimate mashed potatoes: After Step 2, stir 1/2 cup of sour cream, 3 slices of cooked and crumbled bacon, and 1/4 cup of chopped fresh chives into the hot mashed potatoes. Sprinkle more crumbled bacon over top.For ultra-creamy sweet potatoes: Substitute 2 large sweet potatoes (about 2 pounds), peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces (about 5 1/2 cups) for the Yukon Gold potatoes. (Makes 5 servings.) I Made It Print 155 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 173 Calories 8g Fat 23g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 173 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 5g 25% Cholesterol 25mg 8% Sodium 363mg 16% Total Carbohydrate 23g 8% Dietary Fiber 2g 7% Total Sugars 0g Protein 3g 7% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 20mg 2% Potassium 26mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Ultra Creamy Mashed Potatoes from Swanson 01 of 52 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 52 Photo by  Jazmin 11/12/2018 I made the recipe today came out amazingly delicious. The whole family enjoyed it. Minus one of my boys he said it did not have flavor in it. Which was true so I’ll have to figure out what more I can add to give it a little extra flavor. All and All it was delicious will be making again. Thank you for sharing your recipe with me and others. 03 of 52 Photo by  YBCOOKING 03/16/2017 04 of 52 Photo by  happysoupandrice 12/06/2012 A better way to make mashed potatoes! I liked using the chicken broth instead of my regular way - it felt lighter and healthier! I added some garlic salt and lots of pepper - yum! 05 of 52 Photo by  Cwby2nz 12/01/2012 DELICIOUS! I used red potatoes it was all I had. Easy and something other than boring. 06 of 52 Photo by  CoOkInGnUt 11/30/2012 Great recipe They turned out very creamy and light. I had to add extra pepper for taste an a 1/2 tsp butter with a sprinkle of chives. Let me just say Mmmm it was soooooooo good. 07 of 52 Photo by  Amanda 11/30/2012 We loved these potatoes! There is so much flavor cooking the potatoes in the chicken broth! No need to add extra butter and cream. Will be using the recipe often! 08 of 52 Photo by  Kristen Flowers 11/30/2012 I never would have thought to add broth or stock to my potatoes. What a great way to add flavor! 09 of 52 Photo by  Faith N 11/30/2012 These were OK. Kids loved them, husband said they tasted like regular homemade mashed potatoes for him. I liked the flavor boost the stock gave it but the texture wasn't that great (not wallpaper paste but...slightly pasty nonetheless.) 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Bacon Rosemary Mashed Potatoes 40 Ratings Creamy Yukon Mashed Potatoes 33 Ratings Moe's Fabulous Mashed Potatoes 55 Ratings Teena's Bacon and Cheddar Potatoes 34 Ratings Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes 483 Ratings French Tartiflette 27 Ratings Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes 59 Ratings White and Sweet Whipped Potatoes 10 Ratings Simple Vegan Garlicky Potatoes 3 Ratings Pressure Cooker Mashed Potatoes 26 Ratings Mascarpone Mashed Potatoes 74 Ratings Incredible Red Smashed Potatoes 26 Ratings Cedar Planked Spuds 3 Ratings The Best Mashed Potatoes 478 Ratings Buttermilk Parmesan Potatoes 53 Ratings Mashed Sweet Potatoes and Pears 23 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Campbell's Kitchen
instructions: Combine potatoes and chicken broth in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium, cover, and cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes well in a colander, reserving the broth.;Transfer potatoes back to the pan. Add reserved broth, cream, and butter. Mash until smooth and season with salt and pepper.
